title: Best data-labeling AI Tools - Top Picks for 2025
metaDescription: Discover the 12 best data-labeling AI tools in 2025. Compare features, pricing & reviews to find the perfect tool for your needs.
introduction: Looking for the best data-labeling AI tools in 2025? We've analyzed hundreds of tools to bring you this curated list of the top 12 options. Whether you're a developer, business, or individual user, this guide helps you choose the right data-labeling AI tool.

platforms.name: CVAT
platforms.description: CVAT (Computer Vision Annotation Tool) is an open-source, web-based platform designed for the efficient annotation of images and videos for computer vision projects. It provides a comprehensive suite of tools for 2D and 3D data labeling, supports team collaboration, and is built with extensibility in mind through its API and SDK. What makes it unique is its powerful interpolation for video annotation, native support for complex tasks like point clouds and 3D cuboids, and its origin as an Intel project, ensuring robust performance and active development for industrial-scale AI data pipelines.
keyFeatures: Web-based interface for image & video annotation (2D bounding boxes, polygons, polylines, points, cuboids)
Advanced video interpolation for automatic frame-by-frame object tracking
Native support for 3D point cloud annotation (e.g., from LiDAR)

platforms.name: xarray
platforms.description: xarray is an open-source Python library that provides labeled, multi-dimensional arrays and datasets with pandas-like functionality. It enables intuitive analysis of complex scientific data by adding labeled dimensions, coordinates, and attributes to raw NumPy-like arrays, making it particularly powerful for working with climate, weather, oceanography, and geospatial datasets. Its unique value lies in bridging the gap between low-level array computing and high-level labeled data analysis.
keyFeatures: N-D labeled arrays with named dimensions
Seamless integration with Dask for parallel computing
Native support for NetCDF, HDF5, and Zarr file formats

platforms.name: Labelbox
platforms.description: Labelbox is an enterprise-grade data-centric AI platform that enables organizations to build and deploy high-quality AI applications. It provides a unified environment for data labeling, curation, model training, and performance diagnostics across multiple data types including images, video, text, and 3D sensor data. The platform is designed for AI teams at large enterprises and is distinguished by its comprehensive tooling that connects the entire AI development lifecycle from data preparation to model evaluation.
keyFeatures: Automated data labeling with model-assisted pre-labeling to accelerate annotation workflows
Customizable ontology management with support for nested classifications and relationships
Comprehensive quality control system with consensus scoring, review workflows, and audit trails

platforms.name: V7 Darwin
platforms.description: V7 Darwin is an AI data engine designed to automate the creation and management of training data for computer vision models. It specializes in automated annotation, consensus workflows for team collaboration, and provides an integrated model hub for continuous learning. The platform is particularly strong in medical imaging and 3D data annotation, targeting AI/ML teams that need scalable, auditable data pipelines with built-in data governance.
keyFeatures: AI auto-labeling with model-assisted annotation to reduce manual work
Federated QA system for distributed team review and consensus
Model-in-the-loop training with continuous learning from corrections

platforms.name: Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth
platforms.description: Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth is a fully managed data labeling service that helps build highly accurate training datasets for machine learning. It provides built-in workflows, access to human labelers through Amazon Mechanical Turk, third-party vendors, or your own workforce, and uses active learning to automate labeling and reduce costs. It uniquely integrates directly with the SageMaker ecosystem for end-to-end ML development and offers advanced features like automatic 3D point cloud labeling and adjustment workflows.
keyFeatures: Built-in labeling workflows for image, text, video, and 3D point cloud data
Access to a managed workforce (Mechanical Turk, third-party vendors, or private teams)
Automated labeling using Active Learning to reduce manual work by up to 70%

platforms.name: Clarifai
platforms.description: Clarifai is an end-to-end AI platform that enables developers and enterprises to build, deploy, and scale AI applications. Its core capabilities include a vast model zoo for computer vision, natural language processing (NLP), and multimodal AI, combined with tools for custom model training, workflow orchestration, and edge deployment. It uniquely provides a unified, full-stack environment that manages the entire AI lifecycle, from data labeling to inference, distinguishing it from pure model-hosting services.
keyFeatures: Extensive Model Zoo: Access to 1M+ community and 10K+ production-ready pre-trained models for vision, NLP, and audio.
Scribe Data Labeling Tool: Integrated platform for human-in-the-loop data annotation and dataset management.
Workflow Designer: Visual drag-and-drop interface to chain multiple AI models and business logic into automated pipelines.

platforms.name: Doccano
platforms.description: Doccano is an open-source, web-based text annotation tool designed for creating labeled data for natural language processing. Its key capabilities include collaborative annotation for text classification, sequence labeling (NER), and sequence-to-sequence tasks like translation or summarization. It is uniquely positioned as a free, self-hostable alternative to commercial annotation platforms, making it particularly valuable for academic researchers, small teams, and developers needing full control over their data.
keyFeatures: Web-based interface for text classification, sequence labeling (NER), and sequence-to-sequence annotation
Multi-user project management with role-based access control (admin, annotator, annotator-approver)
Support for importing/exporting datasets in formats like JSONL, CSV, CoNLL, and spaCy

platforms.name: SuperAnnotate
platforms.description: SuperAnnotate is an end-to-end platform for creating high-quality training data for computer vision AI. It provides a unified workspace with advanced annotation tools, a managed workforce, and integrated automation to prepare, annotate, and manage datasets. It uniquely combines enterprise-grade project management, native automation models, and a focus on data curation to accelerate the ML pipeline from data to deployment.
keyFeatures: Vector & pixel-based annotation tools (polygons, bounding boxes, cuboids, polylines, points)
Native auto-annotation models for object detection & segmentation to pre-label data
Comprehensive QA workflows with consensus scoring and issue tracking system

platforms.name: Supervisely
platforms.description: Supervisely is a comprehensive, end-to-end computer vision platform that functions as an operating system for AI. It provides integrated tools for managing large-scale image and video datasets, performing advanced annotation, training and deploying neural networks, and building custom applications. Its unique value lies in its unified, web-based environment that combines powerful data management, a flexible app ecosystem, and robust team collaboration features, enabling organizations to streamline their entire computer vision pipeline from data to deployment.
keyFeatures: Unified web-based workspace for managing image & video datasets with versioning and search
Advanced annotation tools for polygons, bounding boxes, keypoints, and semantic/instance segmentation
Integrated NN training with support for PyTorch, TensorFlow, and custom architectures via Python SDK

platforms.name: SentiSight.ai
platforms.description: SentiSight.ai is a no-code computer vision platform that enables users to build, train, and deploy custom object detection, classification, and segmentation models without writing code. It provides a user-friendly interface for labeling data, training models, and integrating predictions via API, making advanced image and video analysis accessible to non-experts. Its unique value lies in combining a streamlined, end-to-end workflow with robust model performance analytics and industry-specific template projects.
keyFeatures: Web-based image and video annotation tools (bounding boxes, polygons, points)
One-click model training for detection, classification, and segmentation tasks
REST API for integrating trained models into applications and workflows

platforms.name: VGG Image Annotator (VIA)
platforms.description: The VGG Image Annotator (VIA) is a standalone, browser-based annotation tool for images, audio, and video, developed by the Visual Geometry Group at the University of Oxford. It enables users to create, edit, and export annotations for computer vision datasets without requiring any installation or server setup. Its key differentiator is being a lightweight, purely client-side application that runs entirely in a web browser while supporting complex annotation tasks like polygons, points, and bounding boxes across multiple media formats.
keyFeatures: Pure client-side operation (no server or installation needed)
Supports multiple annotation shapes: points, rectangles, circles, polygons, polylines
Handles multiple file formats: images (JPG, PNG, etc.), video (MP4, WebM, etc.), audio

platforms.name: Datature
platforms.description: Datature is a unified no-code platform for building, training, and deploying computer vision models, specifically tailored for visual data in medical and industrial domains. Its core capability is streamlining the entire AI pipeline—from collaborative data labeling and annotation to model training, evaluation, and deployment to edge or cloud—without requiring users to write code. It uniquely combines specialized tools for handling DICOM and other medical imaging formats with robust dataset versioning and team collaboration features, making it distinct for domain-specific applications.
keyFeatures: Interactive no-code workflow builder for vision AI pipelines
Integrated annotation studio with tools for polygons, bounding boxes, and DICOM segmentation
Dataset versioning and management with lineage tracking

howToChoose: Define your specific needs and use cases for data-labeling AI tools
Consider your budget and team size
Evaluate required integrations with existing tools
Check free trials or free tiers before committing
Read user reviews and case studies
verdict: All 12 data-labeling AI tools on this list are excellent choices, each with unique strengths. CVAT leads with data-labeling, while xarray offers scientific-computing. Your best choice depends on your specific requirements, budget, and technical expertise.
